report_title: Party and Event Planners Industry Report
executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency. Over the past five years, rising disposable income and a temporary spike in the marriage rate didn't do much to support demand for event planners, as most consumers and businesses lost their footing following a period of economic volatility. When social distancing guidelines eased, party and event planners experienced a moderate surge as clients who postponed their events during the pandemic were eager to celebrate. This temporary advancement was not enough for party planners to significantly recover, with revenue rising at a CAGR of just 0.1% over the past five years. Revenue will total $6.8 billion in 2024, when it will contract 0.8%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Party and Event Planners Aren't a Necessity for Most Consumers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Entry will remain low as virtual event planning services remain popular, allowing new planners to enter and intensify internal competition. Industry revenue is expected to expand at a CAGR of 0.7% to $7.1 billion through the end of 2029. Reduced consumer confidence is detrimental to party and event planners. When consumer confidence fluctuates, consumers prefer to personally plan events to save on the cost of hiring professional event planners.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Potential Corporate Clients Have Cut Spending
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Party and event planners cater to corporate clients, each demanding unique services and affected by differing factors. Businesses seek the services of event planners for holiday parties, fundraisers and client appreciation banquets. Instability in the economy leads to reduced corporate spending. A growth in corporate profit typically supports growth for event planners, but only when business is going well. Despite greater profit, corporations have limited spending on nonessential events.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Temporary Spike in Marriage Offset Losses
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Marriage rates have been falling for nearly a decade, negatively impacting party and event planners. Despite this, a surge in weddings in 2021 and 2022 benefitted party and event planners and boosted revenue. Young adults are increasingly delaying marriage as changing social norms put less pressure on individuals to commit to one life-long partner. As weddings are typically costly, an uptick is a great opportunity for party planners, bolstering performance.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Party and Event Planners Put on Virtual Events
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Because of pent-up demand, falling consumer confidence induced by interest rate hikes and recessionary woes led the marriage rate to fall in 2024. It hindered growth for party and event planners. During the 2020 lockdowns, many industries transitioned to remote work to maintain operations. Party and event planners adapted by focusing on virtual events for corporate clients, organizing online activities like virtual escape rooms, guided classes and games.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rising corporate profit will support revenue growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As businesses see growth in profit and resume corporate dinners and parties, they will require larger venues and amenities. Growing attendance at corporate events bolsters growth for party and event planners. Virtual events will continue to be important especially as many corporations build global teams.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: An increase in leisure time will pressure party and event planners
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: An increase in consumers' leisure time will pressure party and event planners' growth as consumers have more time to plan their events. Depending on the scale of the event, an increase in leisure time encourages consumers to plan an event themselves to save on costs.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The falling marriage rate subdues growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The marriage rate will continue to plummet, stifling demand for party and event planners. Consumers will continue to delay weddings as supply chain woes keep hiking wedding costs. Since party and event planners generate much of the revenue through wedding planning, this ongoing trend will continue to stifle growth potential.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Inflation will induce headwinds for party and event planners
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Inflation will continue to push up the cost of hosting an event, and consumers' willingness to seek out party and event planner services will be in conflict. Recessionary fears early over the outlook period will lead many consumers to postpone significant events.

industry_definition: This industry comprises independent companies and individuals that organize parties, weddings, corporate dinners and other social gatherings on behalf of households, businesses and nonprofits. This industry does not include companies that organize conventions, trade shows and sporting events, nor does it include the internal event planning departments of hotels, conference centers and recreational facilities.
key_trends: The industry is highly fragmented. The level of competition varies depending on the particular geographic region and market segment a company serves.
Party and event planners compete on price, reputation and services offered
Consumers are increasingly going the DIY route for event planning
A boost to corporate profit will support party and event planners through 2029
High market fragmentation and a wide variety of services are offered
Event planners must comply with applicable laws and regulations
Industry associations are the main form of assistance for party and event planners
Cost structures vary between event planners and their specialties.
This distribution of establishments follows the population and income levels in a state or region. For this reason, the Southeast region of the US has the largest number of establishments.

Birthday party planning is less commonly outsourced. More households are opting to plan personal birthday parties themselves, causing a steady drop in the revenue share for professional event planners over the past five years.

Higher-income households supported revenue as volatility hit party planners. Even amid economic uncertainty over the last few years, higher-income households continued to seek party and event planners' services.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment includes businesses of all sizes and across all sectors but does not include corporate trade shows and conferences. Party and event planners organize social events like company dinners, charity events, galas, product launches and themed events for this market.

market_segmentation.segment: Households in the highest income quintile
market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment includes all household consumers within the fourth and highest income quintiles. Consumers in the higher income brackets often have less leisure time and have higher discretionary income to spend on a greater array of entertainment, catering and design elements.

market_segmentation.segment: Households in the fourth-lowest income quintile
market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment includes all household consumers within the fourth and highest income quintiles. Consumers in the higher income brackets often have less leisure time and have higher discretionary income to spend on a greater array of entertainment, catering and design elements.

market_segmentation.segment: Households in the third-lowest income quintile
market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment includes households within the lowest, second and third income quintiles. Consumers in these segments typically have less discretionary income to spend on party and event planners but still account for a consistent portion of demand.

market_segmentation.segment: Households in the second-lowest income quintile
market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment includes households within the lowest, second and third income quintiles. Consumers in these segments typically have less discretionary income to spend on party and event planners but still account for a consistent portion of demand.

market_segmentation.segment: Households in the lowest income quintile
market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment includes households within the lowest, second and third income quintiles. Consumers in these segments typically have less discretionary income to spend on party and event planners but still account for a consistent portion of demand.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment includes planning and providing day-of services for weddings. Event planners will help the couple arrange event food, decor, entertainment, transportation, accommodation, or special requests as needed.
Spending on birthday parties has fallen over the past five years because of decreased reliance on professional event planners.

Corporate social events include company dinners, charity events, holiday parties, summer picnics, employee appreciation events and product launches. Event planners handle corporate events' communications, registration, travel and accommodation arrangements and coordinate an event's food, decor and entertainment.
This segment includes party planning services for religious ceremonies (e.g., bar and bat mitzvahs), retirement parties, graduation parties, festivals, fundraising events, fairs and sporting events.

tier_1_suppliers: Musical Groups & Artists in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The corporate profit level indicates businesses' ability to spend money on holiday parties, company picnics and other social occasions that require professional event-planning services. Higher profit enables businesses to dedicate more funds to events, translating into higher industry revenue and profit. A rise in corporate profit represents a potential opportunity for the industry.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast has the highest concentration of event planning establishments in 2024. The region's large population and many households create significant opportunities for social events. The Southeast's growing population and strong economy contribute to a thriving market of corporate clients, as more businesses can afford to host and plan events regularly. Popular tourist destinations like Florida and Georgia attract destination weddings and large company parties, boosting the number of party-planning businesses.

The Western region holds the second-highest concentration of party and event planning locations in the US. High concentrations of households with annual incomes in the upper two quadrants drive the need for these services. This region is also home to a high concentration of households with annual income levels in the upper two quadrants. Since households with high disposable incomes are the primary source of demand for party and event planning services, the larger pool of consumers within this bracket increases demand for party and event planners.

The Mid-Atlantic region contains the third-highest concentration of establishments in 2024. Within the region, New York has the greatest number of party planning businesses. States in this region have some of the highest populations in the US because of their large metropolitan centers, making them popular destinations for companies specializing in corporate social events. The region also is characterized by higher-than-average income levels. Since households within the region have a disposable income, they can more easily afford upscale party event and planning services.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Parties and events that serve food are subject to laws and regulations relating to food preparation and sale, including regulations regarding product safety, nutritional content and menu labeling.
Events that serve alcoholic beverages must comply with applicable licensing laws and state and local service laws, commonly called dram shop statutes.

The US Department of Labor enforces the Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA). It has established minimum wage, overtime pay, record keeping, child labor laws and other employment standards that impact full-time and part-time employees.
The US Department of Justice enforces the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and prohibits discrimination against people with disabilities in regard to employment.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The revenue volatility level is high.
There is no industry assistance, which is steady.
The capital intensity level is low.
The globalization level is low and steady.

basis_points.basis_description: The industry is highly fragmented. The level of competition varies depending on the particular geographic region and market segment a company serves.
Party and event planners compete on price, reputation and services offered. Having unique offerings is a way for event planners to stand out.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The localized and fragmented nature of industry services keeps market share concentration low.

Most event planners operate on a highly localized and niche market basis. This is because diversified and changing consumer tastes force industry operators to continually adapt their service offerings, which limits their ability to expand geographically.
Event planners specialize in organizing and promoting one type of event, like corporate holiday parties or weddings, further fragmenting the industry.
Low barriers to entry let a large number of event planners enter or exit the industry fluidly.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases account for a significant portion of revenue. Purchase expenses for this industry are substantive and include money spent on third-party services and supplies that go into throwing an event.
Party and event planning almost totally relies on labor, which is needed to arrange rentals, schedule bookings and rent venue spaces.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The party and event planning sector is labor-intensive, relying heavily on employees to manage rentals, schedule bookings and coordinate venue spaces.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue fluctuations are affected by changes in clients' ability to purchase professional planning services. The per capita disposable income level determines households' ability to outsource planning activities to a professional company or individual, while corporate profit determines businesses' ability to do so.

The pandemic significantly disrupted business for party and event planners because of social distancing regulations and the cancellation of most in-person events. Even as restrictions eased in 2020, decreased consumer spending and poor economic conditions limited expenditures in event planning services.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Innovating with sustainable party planning trends
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The party and event planning industry increasingly embraces eco-friendly options as clients demand sustainable and socially responsible event practices. This trend includes using recyclable dinnerware, biodegradable decorations and locally sourced ingredients for catering and food services.

Micro-weddings, which have smaller guest lists and more intimate settings, are a rising trend in the wedding industry, providing a greater focus on details and personalization. Party and event planners are innovating by offering new services for these types of weddings.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales reliant on the overall health of the US economy (i.e. consumer spending and per capita disposable income)?
FAQs.answer: Because events and parties are often highly discretionary, industry revenue is heavily correlated with trends in macroeconomic variables. Improving consumer spending and per capita disposable income have boosted revenue generated across all industry markets.

FAQs.question: What percentage of revenue does your company spend on advertising?
FAQs.answer: It is imperative that party and event planners set themselves apart by marketing themselves through traditional channels, such as television or classified pages, or through modern channels such as social media.

FAQs.question: What are your company's pricing strategies, especially in crowded markets?
FAQs.answer: This distribution of party and event planners generally follows the population and income median income levels by region. An operator that covers a wider geographical area can more easily obtain new business by word of mouth, increasing revenue while costs remain relatively stable.

FAQs.question: How does your company respond to fluctuations in demand?
FAQs.answer: Party and event planners exhibit low barriers to entry. This enables industry participants to easily enter and exit the industry in response to changing operating conditions or cyclical demand for event planning services.

FAQs.question: Is your company leveraging new technology, such as mobile phone applications, to streamline booking and communication with customers?
FAQs.answer: Event planners have had to adapt to smartphones and tablets, social media and viral marketing technologies. This has changed how social event planners organize and operate events, obtain feedback to adjust their service offerings and interact with clients.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing in new technology to improve internal processes?
FAQs.answer: The explosion of idea-sharing social media technologies like Twitter, Pinterest, Facebook and online blogs has revolutionized the event planning industry. Event planners have utilized these technologies to more easily obtain client feedback, market themselves and improve customer satisfaction.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Full-service event planners must make sure the event is in compliance with local and federal requirements. This includes alcohol licensing, capacity limitations, fire and safety, food preparation and smoking regulations.

FAQs.question: How does your company stay ahead of regulations, like food-handling standards?
FAQs.answer: For event catering services, industry operators generally follow The Food and Drug Administration's (FDA) Model Food Code. This is a "best practice" guide to food handling and presentation and is updated annually.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for the seasonality of cash flow?
FAQs.answer: It is important for industry operators to be able to plan for and manage a high degree of seasonality in events such as weddings, birthdays and other social events. These events tend to vary seasonally depending on factors such as weather and holidays.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors'?
Is your company known for its reliability and performance? Has it had any problems with reliability in the past?
FAQs.answer: Having a high prior success rate (including completed prior contracts) Success breeds success in the Party and Event Planners industry and firms that successfully plan social events are more likely to win new and renewed business and attract top performing talent.

FAQs.question: What qualifications must your company's staff have? Does it have a high turnover rate?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators need a staff with a high degree of administrative and organizational skills that readily specialize industry services to client wishes and budgetary constraints.

FAQs.question: Does your company offer a diverse range of services?
FAQs.answer: Party and event planners must be ready to specialize industry services to target different client bases and plan diverse events such as weddings, birthdays, corporate parties and other social events.

FAQs.question: How has your company reallocated its resources in light of declining demand from the marriage sector?
FAQs.answer: Growth in the number of weddings and related receptions per year will likely increase demand for professional event and party planning services.

FAQs.question: Are a large portion of your company's clients individuals?
How will rising per capita disposable income benefit your company?
FAQs.answer: Personal disposable income levels determine consumers' willingness and ability to spend money on professional party and event planning services.

FAQs.question: How does decreasing leisure time affect your business?
FAQs.answer: Time spent on leisure and sports represents Americans' ability to take on planning activities and events on their own.
